pr_title: [ML] Pass job config in JSON file to autodetect

timeline.message:
[ML] Pass job config in JSON file to autodetect

Write job config in the form of a JSON formatted file and pass its
location to autodetect as an additional command line option. This will
ultimately allow all relevant job config to be read from the JSON config
file and hence reduce the number of command line arguments for
autodetect.

timeline.bodyText: nit: I think the indenting is one space off on this line
timeline.author: droberts195

timeline.bodyText: Is the (Class) cast really necessary here?
timeline.author: droberts195

replies.bodyText:
Sadly it is yes. Without it we get the compilation error
java: incompatible types: inference variable T has incompatible equality constraints java.util.List<java.lang.String>,java.util.List

Admittedly the cast isn't nice but there is precedence in e.g. AnalyticsBuilder.java
replies.author: edsavage

replies.bodyText: OK cool, I didn't realise that
replies.author: droberts195

timeline.bodyText:
Please add a comment on the buildJobConfig line to say that it's providing duplicate information as an interim measure while the C++ code is switched over from the old format to the new format.
Also maybe group the buildLimits, buildModelPlotConfig and buildFieldConfig lines together and add a comment to say that they will be removed once the C++ is just using the full job config.
timeline.author: droberts195
droberts195
